arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic’s only negative after win at Crawley - summer signing forced off with groin niggle
arts.sum: Asked about that, a smiling Jones said: “I don’t know who books a caesarean the day before a game but, hey, that is what happens. Charlton Athletic only had one negative from tonight’s 1-0 win at Crawley Town – Josh Edwards going off early in the second half with a groin injury.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss Jones on ‘really professional win’ over Crawley Town
arts.sum: “I don’t want to be disrespectful but they play a way that they let you have chances, hope you don’t score and then hit you on the counter-attack. “It was a very tricky game….a very, very tricky game,” said Charlton manager Nathan Jones.

arts.ttl: Thierry Small effort enough as Charlton maintain play-off push at lowly Crawley
arts.sum: Crawley’s fourth defeat in five matches leaves them nine points from safety with 10 games remaining.

arts.ttl: Former Charlton Athletic midfielder has heavy goal involvement for Blackpool
arts.sum: Morgan recently told the Blackpool Gazette : “It’s so far so good, I’ve got it under control, and I’m getting the hang of it. “It’s still early days, but I’m just taking it day-by-day, and the most important thing for me is continuing my football.

arts.ttl: Crawley boss hails Charlie Barker ahead of Charlton Athletic clash
arts.sum: “We’re having to play people out of position,” said Elliot, who made 109 appearances for the South Londoners as a player. Crawley boss Rob Elliot has hailed former Charlton Athletic centre-back Charlie Barker as an ‘exceptional captain’ after their late 1-1 draw with Reading on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Sunderland, Middlesbrough, Charlton Athletic join race for Scottish Premiership ace
arts.sum: Sunderland, Middlesbrough and Charlton Athletic are among the latest clubs to be linked with a move for Dundee… The post Sunderland, Middlesbrough, Charlton Athletic join race for Scottish Premiership ace appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Charlie Methven leaving role as Charlton Athletic chief executive officer
arts.sum: Carter said: “Charlie has played a key role in helping the club move forward over the last two years and has provided the vision required to drive standards and help the club progress. “He has played a pivotal role in putting the right people in place on both the football and business side of our club, which has resulted in improved performances on the pitch and meaningful increases in our commercial revenues.
